item.title: Interpreting Interaction Terms in Log-Log Regression Models
item.description: p.caption { font-size: 0.8em; } The venerable House Price Competition on Kaggle In the graduate statistics class I’ve TA’ed, we explore a range of regression concepts, both theory and practice. This includes linear and polynomial regression, as well as transformations to align data to certain regression modeling assumptions. At the end of the course, students complete form groups to work on a project…the Kaggle housing prices competition on Ames, Iowa - perhaps the most well known and ongoing competition.
